ARTICLE II. - MISCELLANEOUS FEES 
 
Sec. 46-31. - Copies of documents. 
Service charges for copies of documents shall be as follows: 
(1)  Police Department. 
a.  Report ..... $5.00 
b.  Photographs ..... 5.00 
(2)  Fire report (including ambulance calls) ..... 5.00 
(3)  Engineering Division. 
Blueprints, per page ..... 2.00 
(4)  Health Department. 
a.  Birth certificates: 
First copy ..... 10.00 
Each additional copy ..... 5.00 
b.  Death certificates: 
First certified copy ..... 10.00 
Each additional copy ..... 5.00 
(5)  All departments. 
Photocopy ..... 0.20 
(Code 1979, § 7.02; Ord. No. 01-7-C-3001, § 1, 7-16-2001; Ord. No. 01-9-C-3033, § 1, 9-20-2001; Ord. No. 06-6-C-3442, § 1, 6-19-2006; Ord. No. 09-1-C-3660, § 1, 1-5-2009; Ord. No. 09-11-C-3715, § 1, 11-2-2009)  
Sec. 46-32. - Fee for tendering payment to Village via means that proves to be uncollectible. 
The fee for tendering payment to Village via means that proves to be uncollectible, as provided in Section 70-66, is $10.00 plus any amount charged to the Village by a third party. 
(Code 1979, § 55.36; Ord. No. 09-11-C-3715, § 1, 11-2-2009)  
Sec. 46-33. - Economic development bond fees and deposit. 
(a)  Financing fee. The financing fee for issuance of bonds for economic development projects pursuant to Section 30-43 is $5.00 per $1,000.00 of bonds. 
(b)  Application fee and deposit. The application charge for persons requesting issuance of economic development bonds pursuant to Section 30-44 is $5,000.00. The amount of the deposit required by Section 30-44 is $5,000.00. 
(Code 1979, §§ 3.2413, 3.2414)  
Sec. 46-34. - Fee for exempt transactions under economic development tax provisions. 
The fee for exempt transactions under economic development tax provisions pursuant to Section 98-81 is $25.00. 
(Code 1979, § 10.08; Ord. No. 06-6-C-3442, § 1, 6-19-2006)  
Sec. 46-35. - Automatic dialing devices connected to Police Department. 
The fee for an automatic dialing device to the Police Department is $25.00. 
(Code 1979, § 7.02) 
Cross reference— Burglar alarm systems, § 38-31 et seq.  
Sec. 46-36. - Fire Department Service Fees. 
(a)  Ambulance Transportation. Each person that receives ambulance transportation or emergency medical services from the Village shall be charged a user fee for such ambulance transportation and emergency medical services performed by the Village on behalf of such person. 
(b)  Emergency Incident Cost Recovery Fees. Each property owner or vehicle owner that receives any of the following emergency services from the Village shall be charged the corresponding recovery fee for such services: 
1.  Fire Department response to a motor vehicle accident shall be charged a fee of $550.00; 
2.  Fire Department response to a vehicle fire shall be charged $605.00; 
3.  Fire Department response to structure fire shall be charged $500.00; 
4.  Fire Department response to an incident involving hazardous conditions, excluding hazardous materials, shall be charged $700.00; and 
5.  Fire Department response to an incident requiring a special rescue, including but not limited to: industrial or vehicle extrication, above & below grade, confined space, structural and/or trench collapse incidents shall be charged a fee of $400.00. 
(c)  Billing. The Village Manager or designee shall cause a bill to be issued and sent to the appropriate entity or person responsible for payment for said person having been transported by ambulance, having received emergency medical services or Fire Department Response specified in this section. The Village Manager shall, with the consultation of the Fire Chief and the Director of Finance, establish a schedule of the applicable fees for all services received by a person with regard to ambulance transportation and emergency medical services, including fees for multiple responses as specified in subsection (e) of this section. The Village Manager is authorized to modify or change the fees that may be charged from time to time after consideration of certain factors. Such factors that may be considered by the Village Manager include, but are not limited to, applicable Medicare rates, reimbursement rates, cost standards in the insurance or health care industry, and actual cost of services and supplies. The Village Manager shall cause such schedule of fees to be printed and made available to the public. 
(d)  The Village Manager or designee is hereby authorized to accept payment from Medicare, Medicaid, any Federal health care program, insurers or other third party payers for any fee charged under this section. The fees that are to be charged to persons shall differentiate between nonresidents and residents. 
(1)  In relation to residents, the Village will charge and collect only those amounts that are covered by Federal health care programs, including but not limited to Medicare and Medicaid, insurers or any other third party payers. Such bills will be sent directly to the third parties, with a statement to the resident indicating that the Village will accept the payment by the third party as payment in full. Any and all payments made by the aforesaid third parties for residents, will be accepted by the Village as paid in full and the resident will have no obligation to make any additional payment as a co-payment, deductible or otherwise. 
(2)  In relation to nonresidents, the nonresident shall be liable and responsible for full payment of the transportation and services provided. 
(3)  All fees collected in conformance with this section shall be deposited in the general fund of the Village. 
(e)  Multiple response to person. In the event the Skokie Fire Department responds to the same person more than three (3) times in one (1) calendar year, without ambulance transport to a hospital or another location for treatment but medical treatment and supplies have been dispensed, the Village Manager or designee shall cause a bill to be issued, for fees in accordance with subsections (c) and (d) of this section. 
(f)  Authority to establish additional rules and regulations. The Village Manager is hereby authorized to promulgate rules, regulations and procedures for the implementation of this section. 
(Code 1979, § 7.21; Ord. No. 03-6-C-3172, § 1, 6-2-2003; Ord. No. 19-7-C-4472, § 1, 7-15-2019) 
Cross reference— Emergency services, ch. 38.

Sec. 46-38. - Farmers' market. 
Rental fees for farmers' market spaces shall be as follows: 
(1)  Maximum rental space per permittee. Three market spaces may be rented by any 1 permittee. (Each market space constitutes approximately 2 spaces.) 
(2)  Permanent spaces. The fee for a permanent space on the same site at the market for the entire season shall be $150.00 per space. The fee shall be appropriately discounted if the space is purchased later in the season. 
(3)  Space for 1 day. The fee for space rented for the day on a first come, first served basis until the market is filled shall be $10.00 per space. 
(4)  Collection of fee; transfer of permit; refunds. Fees will be collected by the Village Manager or designee at the market site, in advance of occupancy. Season permits are not transferable and no refunds will be given. 
(5)  Cleanup deposit. The cleanup deposit shall be $50.00. 
(Code 1979, § 7.09; Ord. No. 09-11-C-3715, § 1, 11-2-2009) 
Cross reference— Farmers' market, § 26-631 et seq.

Sec. 46-43. - Appearance and Arts Fee. 
An Appearance and Arts Fee is hereby established at 0.1 percent, calculated for each permit and based upon the construction valuation, provided the valuation of construction meets or exceeds $10,000.00. There is no fee for construction valuation of $9,999.99 and below. Said fees shall be collected by the Community Development Department at the time of permit issuance, and the fees to be placed in a segregated account for the exclusive purpose of providing funding for the Public Arts Program outlined in Section 2-1084 and for the maintenance of buildings and land owned or controlled by the Village of Skokie used for the display of art or for the performing arts. The Village Manager or his designee shall determine the allocation of funds to allowable uses. 
(Ord. No. 11-12-C-3866, § 1, 12-5-2011; Ord. No. 19-2-C-4444, § 3, 2-19-2019)

Sec. 46-44. - Public Sidewalk Installation and Repair Fee.

There is no fee for construction value of $9,999.99 and below. Said fee is due at the time of permit issuance and placed in a segregated account for the exclusive purpose of providing funding for the Public Sidewalk Installation and Repair Program outlined in Sections 2-1231 through 2-1233. 
(Ord. No. 12-5-C-3905, § 2, 5-21-2012; Ord. No. 19-2-C-4444, § 3, 2-19-2019)  
Sec. 46-45. - Utility Relocation and Undergrounding Fee.

There is no fee for construction value of $9,999.99 and below. Said fee is due at the time of permit issuance and placed in a segregated account for the exclusive purpose of providing funding for the Utility Relocation and Undergrounding Program outlined in Sections 2-1234 through 2-1236. 
(Ord. No. 19-2-C-4444, § 3, 2-19-2019)

Sec. 46-75. - Athletic exhibitions, gross receipts tax. 
Any person conducting an athletic contest or exhibition shall submit to the Village Manager or designee a statement of the gross receipts of each such race, game, contest or exhibition within 1 week after such exhibition. At the same time, the person conducting, operating or sponsoring such race, game, contest, or exhibition shall pay to the Village Manager or designee a sum equal to 3 percent of the gross receipts. 
(Code 1979, § 7.04) 
Cross reference— Athletic exhibitions, § 14-121 et seq.  
Sec. 46-76. - Carnivals, circuses, fairs and other amusements. 
The permit fee for conducting any carnival or other amusement described in Chapter 14, Article VII, is $75.00 for processing the permit application, plus the actual cost of inspection, which shall be determined by the Village Manager. In no event shall the permit fee exceed $300.00. 
(Code 1979, § 7.06) 
Cross reference— Carnivals, circuses, fairs and other amusements, § 14-271 et seq.  
Sec. 46-77. - Charitable soliciting. 
(a)  At the time of filing an application for a permit for charitable soliciting, a fee of $25.00 shall be paid to cover the cost of investigating the application and issuing the permit. 
(b)  The Mayor and Board of Trustees, at any regular meeting, may, upon receipt of written request by an applicant, waive the requirement for the payment of the fee. 
(Code 1979, § 7.07) 
Cross reference— Charitable solicitations, § 78-91 et seq.  
Sec. 46-78. - Foreign fire insurance companies. 
Every corporation, company or association not incorporated under the laws of the State to engage in providing fire insurance or to transact any business of fire insurance in the Village shall pay to the Village a sum of money equal in amount to 2 percent per annum of the gross receipts received as premiums by any and all agents of any such corporation, company, or association upon fire insurance policies issued or to be issued on any property in the Village. Such payments shall be made by July 15 for the year ending July 1 each year. 
(Code 1979, § 34.08) 
Cross reference— Foreign fire insurance companies, § 50-40.  
Sec. 46-79. - Hotels and motels, gross receipts tax. 
For the use and privilege of renting of rooms in a hotel or motel in the Village, a tax is hereby levied at a rate of seven and ½ percent (7.5%) on the gross rental receipts. Renting a residence or room in a residence for a period of less than 30 days shall be subject to this tax. 
(Code 1979, § 7.11; Ord. No. 02-5-C-3079, § 1, 5-6-2002; Ord. No. 14-7-C-4077, § 1, 7-21-2014; Ord. No. 19-2-C-4444, § 4, 2-19-2019) 
Cross reference— Hotel-motel tax, § 98-141 et seq.

ARTICLE IV. - BUILDING PERMITS AND RELATED FEES 
 
Sec. 46-111. - Generally. 
(a)  Building permit fees, inspection fees and bond amounts shall be in accordance with this article. 
(b)  Fees for street and sidewalk work are set forth in Article V of this chapter. Fees for water and sewer connections are set forth in Article VI of this chapter. 
(Code 1979, § 7.05)  
Sec. 46-112. - Determination of estimated cost of construction. 
The Village Manager or designee, at the Village Manager's or designee's discretion, may use any one or a combination of the following procedures in determining the estimated cost of construction for computing building permit fees: 
(1)  Accept an estimate furnished to the Village Manager or designee by the applicant for the permit. 
(2)  Require a certificate of such estimated cost from a licensed architect or a registered structural or professional engineer. 
(3)  Require an affidavit from the owner or the owner's agent setting forth the estimated cost of the proposed work. 
(4)  Preparation of an estimate of cost by the Village Manager or designee. 
(Code 1979, § 7.05(24); Ord. No. 01-7-C-3001, § 2, 7-16-2001)  
Sec. 46-113. - Building permits, new construction and additions. 
(1)  Preliminary Plan Review 
Residential ..... $100.00 plus $50.00 per unit 
Other developments ..... $100.00 plus $50.00 per 1,000 square feet 
(2)  Preliminary Site Visit ..... $50.00 per inspector 
(3)  Plan review/permit fee 
Residential ..... $200.00* plus 1.15 percent of construction costs 
Other developments ..... $500.00* plus 1.15 percent of construction costs 
*Nonrefundable deposit 
(Code 1979, § 7.05(1); Ord. No. 00-7-C-2905, § 1, 7-17-2000; Ord. No. 06-6-C-3442, § 1, 6-19-2006; Ord. No. 09-11-C-3715, § 1, 11-2-2009; Ord. No. 15-7-C-4155, § 1, 7-6-2015)

(3)  A fee for a second reinspection because a violation has not been corrected shall be $100.00. This fee will be applicable for any inspector or agent of the Village, regardless of Village department.

Sec. 46-134. - Contractors' surety bonds and registration fees. 
A registration fee and surety bond is required in the amount required in this section, executed by a surety company authorized to transact business in the State as surety on the bond, with the applicant as principal on the bond, and the Village as obligee for its benefits, and consumers dealing with the applicant, conditioned that the applicant shall faithfully perform the duties and in all things comply with all regulations, codes and ordinances of the Village as may be amended from time to time pertaining to the license or permit applied for. The aggregate liability of the surety, regardless of the number of claims made against the bond or the number of years the bond remains in force, shall in no event exceed the amount of the bond. The bond may be terminated at any time by the surety upon sending notice in writing to the Village and to the principal, and, at the expiration of 30 days from the mailing of the notice, the bond shall terminate and the surety shall thereupon be relieved from any liability for any acts or omissions of the principal subsequent to that date. By requiring and issuing such license and permit bond, the Village is making no representation as to the quality of the contractor's work. The general contractor's bond shall cover the work of all sub contractors. If there is no general contractor on the permit application, each contractor performing work must pay the registration fee and obtain a bond.

Cement contractor 	50.00 	10,000.00 
Mason contractor 	50.00 	10,000.00 
Carpenter 	50.00 	10,000.00 
Heating contractor 	50.00 	10,000.00 
Plumbing contractor 	State license 	State bond

ARTICLE V. - STREET, SIDEWALK, AND RIGHT-OF-WAY WORK[3] 

Footnotes: 
--- (3) --- 
Cross reference— Fees for construction of parking areas and driveways, § 46-125; streets and sidewalks, § 90-31 et seq. 
 
Sec. 46-161. - Permit fees for work in public right-of-way. 
(a)  Generally. The following fees shall accompany an application for a permit for work in the public right-of-way not covered by the provisions of Section 90-87(f): 
(1)  Filing fee. 
a.  Curb cuts ..... $100.00 for each curb cut 
for the purposes of reconstructing, altering or repairing the curb. 
b.  Tunneling, opening or excavation ..... $200.00. 
c.  Simultaneous work. No additional fee and only 1 permit shall be required when streets, sidewalks, alleys, curbs or curb cuts are to be simultaneously constructed, reconstructed, altered, repaired, laid or surfaced. 
d.  Parkway opening ..... $100.00 for each opening. 
e.  Street opening ..... $200.00 per opening 
(removed from 46-125 and added here). 
(2)  Inspection, supervision and engineering fee. 
a.  The Village shall charge a fee for inspection, supervision and engineering services performed and for other emergency and non-emergency responses by Village staff, pursuant to any permit for work done in the public right-of-way, by any entity or individual, other than the Village of Skokie. 
b.  The fee shall be calculated as follows: $0.60 per inch of the facility or improvement, that is being installed, repaired or maintained, multiplied by the number of linear feet of said facility or improvement. If it is the case that no such improvement/facility is being installed or repaired, or the excavation is two (2) feet wider or more than the facility, the fee shall be determined by $0.60 per inch of the widest diameter of the opening in the public right-of-way multiplied by the number of linear feet of the actual excavation in the public right-of-way. 
c.  Facilities are to be defined as set forth in Section 90-2 of the Code including but not limited to piping, cables and drains. 
d.  Driveways ..... $0.10 per square foot for each driveway. 
e.  Sidewalk ..... $50.00 plus $0.10 per square foot. 
(Code 1979, § 7.14; Ord. No. 06-6-C-3442, § 1, 6-19-2006; Ord. No. 11-12-C-3866, § 1, 12-5-2011; Ord. No. 17-5-C-4285, § 1, 5-15-2017)  
Sec. 46-162. - Cash bond for sidewalks. 
A cash bond shall be paid to insure the installation or replacement of a sidewalk. The amount shall be determined on a linear foot basis. The linear foot cost shall be determined by the Public Works Department based on the current cost of sidewalk construction or replacement. The bond, less penalties, shall be refunded if the sidewalk is installed or replaced in compliance with Village Code requirements. 
(Code 1979, § 7.05(17); Ord. No. 04-12-C-3320, § 4, 12-6-2004; Ord. No. 11-12-C-3866, § 1, 12-5-2011)  
Sec. 46-163. - Charge for placement of barricades by Village. 
The charge for placement of barricades by the Village at construction or excavation sites as described in Section 90-47 is $20.00 per day per barricade.  
Sec. 46-164. - Construction in the public right-of-way. 
An application for a permit for construction in the public right-of-way, as authorized pursuant to Section 90-87(f), shall be accompanied by a fee of $550.00. If subsequent to the initial inspections and review, the Village staff is of the opinion that additional review, inspections, and/or outside engineering or other services, should such be required, said costs shall be the responsibility of the permit applicant. This fee shall be in addition to any other fees or requirements required by this Code. 
(Ord. No. 08-3-C-3606, § 1, 3-17-2008)  
Secs. 46-165—46-190. - Reserved.

The permit fee for installation of air conditioning equipment shall be $1.00 per ton of installed capacity of the system. The annual demand charge for any such air conditioning system of over 5 tons capacity installed prior to May 25, 1965, shall be $20.00 per ton of capacity for the total tons of capacity over and above 5 tons, unless the use of water from the Village mains for such system shall be limited to a maximum of 0.2 gallon per minute per ton of capacity. This demand charge is in addition to the regular charges for water use. 
(Code 1979, § 7.184)

ARTICLE VII. - MOTOR VEHICLES, TRAFFIC AND PUBLIC PASSENGER VEHICLES[5] 

Footnotes: 
--- (5) --- 
Cross reference— Motor vehicles and traffic, ch. 106; vehicles for hire, ch. 114. 
 
Sec. 46-221. - Motor vehicle licenses. 
(a)  License fees. The annual fees for motor vehicle licenses issued under Article III of Chapter 106 shall be as follows: 
(1)  For any motor bicycle, motorscooter or motorcycle, or moped, the fee shall be $20.00. 
(2)  For any passenger automobile or any vehicle bearing the State classification of "RV," the fee shall be $40.00. 
(3)  For any trailer which is designed to be towed by a passenger vehicle, the fee shall be $20.00, which shall be paid by the owner thereof. 
(4)  For any motor vehicle licensed by the State under a dealer's registration plate and operating upon the public highways of this State, the fee shall be $40.00. 
(5)  For any vehicle or bus used in the transportation of persons for hire in the Village in regular scheduled service, or using any loading or unloading zone or space provided for the loading or unloading of persons within the Village, pursuant to a certificate of convenience and necessity granted by the Illinois Commerce Commission, under the jurisdiction of any nonresident transportation company, there shall be no license fee. 
(6)  For any motor vehicle owned and operated by any park, school district, educational institution or other municipal corporation within the Village, there shall be no license fee. 
(7)  For any motor bus or vehicle of a resident private carrier for hire, if used exclusively as a school bus for any school district, or religious, eleemosynary or denominational institution, which is neither owned nor operated by such district or institution, the fee shall be $1.00. 
(8)  Every motor truck, trailer or semi-trailer designed for the carrying of loads shall be classified as to gross, tare and net weights. Such classification shall be identified by the prefix letter on the plate furnished by the Illinois Secretary of State, and the license fees for such vehicles shall be as follows: 
SCHEDULE OF TRUCK FEES 
Classification 	Gross Weight, Including Vehicle and Maximum Load (pounds) 	Fee 
B 	8,000 and less 	$40.00 
D 	8,001 to 12,000 	$57.50 
F 	12,001 to 16,000 	$66.25 
H, TH, J, TJ, K, TK, L, TL, N, TN 	16,001 to 40,000 	$75.00 
P, TZ, Q, TQ, R, TR, S, TS, T, TT, V, TV, X, TX, Z, TZ 	40,001 to 80,000 	$105.00 
TA 	3,000 or less 	$31.25 
TB, TC, TD, TE 	3,001 to 14,000 	$35.00 
TG, TK, TL, TN 	14,001 to 46,000 	$60.00 
 
(9)  A self-propelled vehicle operated as a tractor and 1 semi-trailer shall be considered as 1 vehicle in computing the license fee under this section. Additional semi-trailers to be used with such tractor shall be licensed at an annual fee of $10.00. 
(10)  There shall be no vehicle license fee charged for any vehicle with respect to which the State has granted an absolute or partial exemption from the State license fee requirements. 
(11)  The fee for vehicles not specified in this section shall be $15.00. 
(12)  License fees shall be increased by 50% of the fee required for the applicable license if the license is purchased after August 31 as to annual fees, and after December 31 as to semiannual fees. There shall be no increase in the stipulated fees, however, if application for a license is made within 30 days after the applicant has acquired title to such vehicle. The payment of any fee shall not exempt any person from any other penalties imposed for the operation of a motor vehicle without the display of a proper license. 
(13)  All motor vehicle licenses purchased electronically, (either by the Village's website or through Village designated third party vendors, as maybe utilized from time to time), shall receive a discount of $5.00 if purchased prior to the date set forth in Section 106-157. 
(b)  Proration of fees. Except for motor bicycles, motorscooters, and motorcycles, vehicles of auto dealers and school buses, the annual license fee for a motor vehicle shall be reduced by 50 percent if the applicant became the owner of the motor vehicle or a resident of the Village after December 31 of any year. 
(c)  Transfer of license to newly acquired vehicle. When an owner disposes of a vehicle, the owner may transfer the license to a newly acquired vehicle upon payment of a $5.00 fee. 
(d)  New residents. Where an owner having a vehicle registered in another Illinois municipality becomes a resident of the Village, the owner may purchase a current vehicle license for a fee of $5.00. 
(e)  Duplicate license. A duplicate license to replace a lost or stolen license may be purchased for a fee of $5.00. 
(Code 1979, § 7.13; Ord. No. 06-4-C-3428, § 1, 4-3-2006; Ord. No. 14-6-C-4066, §§ 1, 2, 6-2-2014; Ord. No. 19-2-C-4444, § 7, 2-19-2019) 
Cross reference— Motor vehicle licenses, § 106-151 et seq.
